name: ScanIPAddreses
description: Checks to see if any user has accessed the VSTS account from an IP Address outside of the allowed IP range specified.
author: Swellaby
helpMarkDown: Replace with markdown to show in help
instanceNameFormat: This is how the task displays

inputs.name: accountName
inputs.label: VSTS Account Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of your account (the part that comes before the '.visualstudio.com' in the URL.

inputs.name: accessToken
inputs.label: Personal Access Token
inputs.helpMarkDown: A personal Access Token (PAT) that has access to make REST API calls to the specified VSTS Account

inputs.name: ipRange
inputs.label: Valid IP Range/CIDR Blocks (IPV4)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The valid ranges or blocks of IP Addresses. Enter each block on its own line.

inputs.name: timePeriod
inputs.label: Time Period
inputs.helpMarkDown: Controls which time period of activity will be scanned (UTC Standard).

inputs.name: userOrigin
inputs.label: User Origin
inputs.helpMarkDown: Controls which set of users will be scanned. Azure Active Directory will only scan traffic from accounts that come from your AAD tenant. All will scan traffic for every single user identity that has access to your VSTS acount, which includes several internal/non-user VSTS accounts.

inputs.name: scanInternalVstsServices
inputs.label: Include Internal VSTS Activity?
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies whether or not the scan should include activity records that were created by internal VSTS services. This should almost always be set to false
